H0.text: Which British artist achieved notoriety in 1976 after confessing to faking old masters. Shaun Greenhalgh

H1.text: Which British artist achieved notoriety in 1976 after confessing to faking old masters. Eric Hebborn

H2.text: Which British artist achieved notoriety in 1976 after confessing to faking old masters. John Myatt

H3.text: Which British artist achieved notoriety in 1976 after confessing to faking old masters. Tom Keating

A4.text: In 1984 Hebborn admitted to a number of forgeries â€“ and feeling as though he had done nothing wrong, he used the press generated by his confession to denigrate the art world.

A5.text: Hebborn continued to create his forgeries, changing his style slightly to avoid any further unmasking, and manufactured at least 500 more drawings between 1978 and 1988.

A6.text: In 1999 he was convicted of conspiracy to defraud and imprisoned for four months.

A7.text: Since his conviction, Myatt has continued to paint in the style of famous artists, selling his works as 'genuine fakes'.
